question: 添付
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>Append</kanji> and <kanji>attach</kanji> this document to your email. It's an <vocabulary>attachment</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading for <ja>添</ja> is what you'd expect. The reading for <ja>付</ja> is the on'yomi reading, which you've never learned. It's <ja>ふ</ja>, but for this word it becomes <ja>ぷ</ja> from the rendaku fairies. Just think of an <vocabulary>attachment</vocabulary> where instead of a document or something, you get an attachment of <reading>poo</reading>p (<ja>ぷ</ja>). What a gross attachment. Your friend who likes to send poop attachments is dumb.
